custom_fields.key_topics: The course will cover cults, persuasion, persuasive tactics, and attitudes.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: There will be three assignments, an ads portfolio about the persuasive techniques used in advertising, a short quiz, and a 5-10 minute presentation on a cult.
custom_fields.goals: The primary goals of the course are to 1 understand attitudes and persuasion and how they are interconnected 2 identify key theories, principles, and strategies of social influence and persuasion 3 understand how compliancegaining techniques are used in cults.
custom_fields.relevance: Students will understand persuasion and the formation and workings of cults, how advertisers use persuasion techniques, and how to avoid falling victim to these techniques.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Supplementary readings, Powerpoints, and Youtube videos uploaded/linked to Canvas

long_desc: There are many cults active today, despite the very public demise of many wellknown ones. Some cult members believe that mediation has healing abilities, while others believe in cannibalism and mass murder. Many have been active for decades, some as old as a century, with a few others that sprung up only in the last few years. What these groups share is a charismatic leader and the belief that they are chosen above all others. In this course, we will discuss how cults come to be through defining persuasion and identifying the factors that influence it and how cult leaders utilize them. We will also introduce some famous cults and their leaders.
name: Cults & Persuasion
